job_description: Acquisition Management and Planning Analyst, Mid-Level - job post Tecolote Research, Inc. 44 reviews El Segundo, CA 90245 $80,000 - $120,000 a year -  Part-time You must create an Indeed account before continuing to the company website to apply Apply on company site save-icon Job details Salary $80,000 - $120,000 a year Job Type Part-time Overview We are seeking an Acquisition Management and Planning Analyst to perform a variety of acquisition management, planning, and analysis duties in support of Air Force and Space Force programs. Responsibilities The Acquisition Management and Planning Analyst performs a variety of acquisition management, planning, analysis duties in support of Air Force programs. In this role, you will focus specifically on the acquisition management, planning, analysis and execution of enterprise cross-mission ground development, acquisition, and operations. You will interact with a multidisciplinary DoD technical workforce and defense hardware contractors in the accomplishment of their duties. You will evaluate and support the development of program documentation, which includes acquisition strategies, systems engineering plans, Integrated Master Plans and Contract Data Requirements Lists, for adherence to DoD and Air Force policies and guidance. Responsibilities and tasks will also include: Perform market research and provide acquisition strategy recommendations Advise and assist in organizing and establishing Integrated Product Teams Analyze progress against program plan and schedule Evaluate program plan for compliance with applicable DoD and Air Force policies and guidance Draft and prepare written communication materials to include; program acquisition point papers, briefings, articles, media releases, communication plans, and responses to requests for information Salary Range: $80,000.00 - $120,000.00/Year, DOE Skills Required At least eight (8) equivalent years of experience performing Acquisition Management and Planning activities in the government (military and/or civil servant), federally funded research and development center, or profit / non-profit government support / development Contractor arena. Two (2) years shall include duties/assignments specifically in support of space acquisition programs. Bachelor’s degree in Management, Business, Economics, Finance, Accounting, Mathematics, Engineering, Technology, Engineering, or Operations Research is required. Knowledge of various quantitative techniques used to analyze data, develop models, interpret results and brief senior level DoD leadership. Must be able to work independently, as well as with at team, on time-sensitive high visibility tasks. Knowledge of DoD budgetary principles and procedures. Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Strong analytical skills and problem-solving abilities. Demonstrated knowledge of acquisition management regulations, practices, policies, and procedures associated with Major Defense Acquisition Programs. At least two (2) years of experience using Software Tools: MS Office, MAR Reporting-PMRT/SMART, and CCaR. Active Department of Defense Secret Clearance (required). US citizenship (required). Education Bachelor’s degree required, preferably in math, engineering, business, or the sciences. schedule Part-Time groups Senior-Level Security Clearance Benefits We offer competitive salaries commensurate with education and experience. We have an excellent benefits package that includes: Health & Welfare Company Paid Major Medical Insurance for employees and family members Dental Insurance for employees and family members Vision Insurance for employees (employee-paid for family members) Group Life Insurance Accidental Death and Dismemberment Insurance Travel Accident Insurance Long-Term Disability Voluntary Short-Term Disability Supplemental Life Insurance Flexible Spending Account (pre-tax deferrals for health care expenses) Retirement Money Purchase Pension Plan - 100% Company funded defined contribution retirement plan. One-year entry waiting period and 5-year vesting. Core Funds available and a self-directed brokerage account option. Employee Stock Ownership Plan - 100% Company funded discretionary contribution. 100% vested after one-year entry waiting period. Time Off Tecolote’s generous paid time off benefits give employees the flexibility they need to relax, recharge and take care of the unexpected. Annual Leave Bereavement Leave Holidays Jury Duty/Witness Leave Military Leave Sick Leave Los Angeles Operations 2120 East Grand Avenue, Suite 200 El Segundo, CA 90245 (310) 640-4700

Research Data Analyst I - job post University of California - Irvine 517 reviews Orange, CA 92868 $28.02 - $49.66 an hour -  Part-time You must create an Indeed account before continuing to the company website to apply Apply on company site save-icon Job details Salary $28.02 - $49.66 an hour Job Type Part-time The Department of Medicine is comprised of 11 Divisions by Medicine Subspecialty. The post award team in the Finance unit is responsible for management of more than $29 million in contracts, grants and research funding. This centralized unit provides expertise and financial management for contracts, grants, and university allocations for research. Under the supervision of the Principal Investigator and Co-Investigator, the incumbent will assist with the implementation of research protocols for human subjects experimental/clinical research studies. Involves gathering, analyzing, and interpreting a wide variety of research data.Assists with collectecting data samples, developing research instruments, analyzing collected information according to established statistical methods, and developing recommendations based on research findings. Prepares reports, charts, tables, and other visual aids to interpret and communicate data and results. Total Compensation: In addition to the salary range listed below, we offer a wealth of benefits to make working at UCI even more rewarding. These benefits may include medical insurance, sick and vacation time, retirement savings plans, and access to a number of discounts and perks. Please utilize the links listed here to learn more about our compensation practices and benefits. $28.02 - $49.66 (Hourly Rate) Required: 1-2 years of relevant work experience with a Master’s degree in a biological field, social sciences, or public health, or equivalent experience. Bachelor's degree in related area and / or equivalent experience / training. 1-2 years of relevant work experience with a Master’s degree in a biological field, social sciences, or public health, or equivalent experience Clear and professional communication skills; written and verbal. Proficiency in NIVIVO, MAXQDA or equivalent software Proficiency in STATA, SAS or R or equivalent analysis software Experience with data management and analysis. Organized and able to set task priorities. Prior research experience with demonstrated independent responsibilities and activities. Demonstrated ability to conduct research protocols with critical attention to detail. Preferred: Spanish fluency (reading, writing, and conversing). Experience with kidney disease research. Special Conditions Required: This position requires travel in personal car throughout Los Angeles and Orange County.
